channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oil prices in retreat despite prospect of Mideast and storm ruction
TikTok's use of casino-like currency to allegedly exploit children faces scrutiny in DC lawsuit
item.description: The District of Columbia attorney general alleges that TikTok operates an alleged "unlicensed virtual currency" as part of its TikTok LIVE feature.

item.title: Bayer shares down 7% after U.S. court says it will review Monsanto case
item.description: The company said in a statement Wednesday that there was "no basis for a different outcome on appeal."

item.title: Ozempic underworld: Inside the black market of obesity drugs
item.description: A CNBC investigation into illegal weight loss drugs reveals a marketplace where criminals brazenly counterfeit the drugs or ship the real product from...

item.title: Boeing’s stock falls as talks with union hit an impasse
Capitalism hasn’t forgotten the construction industry. Its reluctance to rely on technology is for good reason
item.description: 'Try asking ChatGPT to handle that kind of complexity and manage those types of human interactions,' write Dan Tishman and Peter Lehrer.

item.title: Wimbledon will evict line judges from its tennis matches after 147 years—and turn to AI instead
item.description: Wimbledon has been largely unchanged since 1877. But a tweak to the Grand Slam's judging process will shake up how it's historically been run.

item.title: Nike, Honeywell, Goldman Sachs and IBM are top advancers as Dow jumps 120 points
Warren Buffett's S&P 500 bet paid off. Experts weigh in on whether it's still a winning strategy
item.description: Investing in an S&P 500 index fund can let you take a set-it-and-forget-it approach. But some experts say you could be missing an opportunity to diver...

item.title: TSMC third quarter sales rise sharply, beat estimates
Chine stocks tumble again with Beijing to discuss fiscal policy Saturday
Why health care could be a winner heading into year-end
item.description: Looking for a sector to invest in for the 2024 home stretch? Health care may be the answer, if history is any indication.

item.title: Trump’s $60 Bibles are printed in China, the same country he’s accused of stealing American jobs
item.description: The bibles cost less than $3 to make.

item.title: What the Waffle House Index says about Hurricane Milton
item.description: Plus, a guide to its history and how the index works.

item.title: How T-Mobile’s corporate culture powered it to become the world’s most valuable telecom company
item.description: T-Mobile may be big but it's still a 'scrappy, fast-growing, entrepreneurial company,' says the CEO.
